english: If the newspaper industry was not in trouble, why had so many newspapers succumbed ?
chinese: 那么，既然报纸行业并未陷入困境，却又为什么有如此众多的大报纷纷倒闭呢？

english: Sorry to interrupt , sir , but it ' s major cohen of the atlanta journal
chinese: 抱歉打扰亚特兰大报的科恩少校来电

english: So when it held a news conference the big papers could not ignore it
chinese: 因此当它召开了一次新闻发布会之后大报们也不能忽视它了。

english: Helen ： yes . we ' re putting full - page ads in the sunday edition of three major newspapers
chinese: 海伦：有的。我们会在三家大报的周日版登全页广告。

english: Mr murdoch is much more like america ' s great newspaper proprietors than his critics imagine
chinese: 默多克先生比他的批评者想象地更像是美国大报的所有者。
大报造句挺难的，這是一个万能造句的方法

english: At that time , the island s two leading newspapers , including the united daily news and
chinese: 彼时，国内两大报系：中国时报和联合报，经常刊登学者所撰写的专栏。

english: Helen ： yes . we ' re putting the same full - page ad in the sunday edition of three major new apers
chinese: 海伦：有的。我们在三大报的星期天版面放了相同的全版广告。

english: Helen ： yes . we ' re putting the same full - page ad in the sunday edition of three major newspapers
chinese: 海伦：有的。我们在三大报的星期天版面放了相同的全版广告。

english: For a broadsheet , the telegraph seems to run an awful lot of tabloidy celebrity articles
chinese: 作为一份大报， 《电讯报》似乎发表了太多的以明星为内容的小报式文章。

english: Yet the evidence of a global trend of broadsheet newspapers converting to compact formats is inconsistent
chinese: 但大报向小型版式转变的全球趋势表现出来的却是不一致的迹象。

english: Several broadsheet papers have changed to a smaller format recently , but still nobody calls them " tabloids " . probably a reputation thing
chinese: 近来，一些大报已将版式改小，但仍然没有人将其称为“小报” 。可能与名声有关。

english: It is easier to launch a new compact format than convert from larger format for reasons of advertising , history , and internal objections to change
chinese: 比起由于广告、历史和内部反对改变等因素而把大报改成小报，推出全新的小报式更为容易。

english: As the sole broadsheet newspaper among the morning papers in beijing , it adopts the international fashion of slim size , published daily , printed with colors
chinese: 作为京城早报中唯一的一份对开大报，她采用国际流行的瘦报规格，每日出版，彩色印刷。

english: Morton was a journalist and soon became editor of nebraska ? s first newspaper , then he became a member of the nebraska state board of agriculture
chinese: 莫尔顿当时是一位记者，不久成为内布拉斯加州第一家大报的编辑，后来又当选为内布拉斯加州农业委员会委员。
